name.en-US: BMI Monier ThermalFoil Delexe Bubble R

content.value: As the worlds leading drone manufacturer, DJI produces innovative products that make data collection faster, easier and more cost-effective - providing roofers with a competitive edge from as early as the bidding process.

DJI drone solutions map all types of work sites to provide detailed, precise data for contractors. Quickly and easily collect enriched visual data to evaluate requirements, even for sites in remote and inaccessible locations.

Using drone-based 3D modeling and BIM software, contractors can develop designs with a comprehensive understanding of site conditions. From a safe position on the ground, contractors can use a range of high quality, intelligent imaging features to assess the condition of a roof, detect and identify defects and to propose cost-effective solutions.
BMI Group is pleased to confirm DJI as one of its brand partners.
BMI RoofPro members can now benefit from a 5% discount across all DJI products.
To claim this exclusive member discount simply contact
Poladrone Solutions Sdn Bhd
(ourapproved local DJI distributor)and quote your BMI RoofPro reference number when ordering.
Contact Poladrone
Quote your BMI RoofPro reference number
Select from a comprehensive range of innovative products
Claim your 5% discount
Expensify automates every step of the expense management process, from receipt scanning to exporting into your accounting solution.

Upload a receipt using SmartScan and patented OCR technology automatically reads and codes the receipt details for you. Receipts are added to an expense report, which is automatically submitted and approved in just one click!

Company card transactions are automatically populated, making it easy for administrators to manage expenses. Administrators can also customise expense policy rules and configure multi-level approval workflows.

Any changes made in your accounting system are automatically synchronized with Expensify in real-time for constant visibility. It simplifies financial audits and tax returns, and gives you complete control and visibility over company finances.
Visit the EXPENSIFY website
Complete an online application
Enter 713498712934783914789347 before submitting the subscription
Enjoy 3 months free subscription to Expensify services
Enterprise Rent-A-Car is the worlds largest transportation solutions provider, with an extensive network, fleet and range of services.

Enterprise services include local and airport rentals, car sharing, exotic car hire and van hire, along with its Flex-E-Rent division, providing business solutions for long-term commercial vehicle and specialised fleet needs.
BMI Group is pleased to confirm Enterprise Rent-A-Car as one of its brand partners.
BMI RoofPro members can now benefit from preferential BMI rates when using Enterprise services.
Visit the ENTERPRISE BMI PORTAL
Select from either sadf or rerel options
Confirm your booking and enjoy preferential BMI rates
Enroll in the Enterprise/National Emerald Club for additional benefits
SIXT combines global car rental and local share solutions as well as taxi, carpooling and chauffeur services in one of the worlds largest mobility platforms.

We offer our customers digital access to more than 270,000 vehicles and around 1.5 million connected drivers in approximately 110 countries worldwide. Besides its own range of vehicles, SIXT also integrates services from more than 1,500 mobility partners.
Visit the DSDWRRWRR PORTAL
Click on asag3535
Confirm your requirements and enjoy preferential BMI rates
Apply for a SIXT Card by completing an adsadfafdd

header.en-US: Probably the best tiles in the world

body.en-US: Weatherproof to 7 sigma degrees of certainty. BMI can handle whatever the climate will throw at you.

header.en-US: Reach the tiles other roofers cannot reach

body.en-US: Our polymorphic multi-axial asymmetrical tessellation patterns with fit the most complex shapes your architects can imagine.
We have the largest cache of legacy roof patterns and tiles in Mapleland. Old or new. We've got you covered.

header.en-US: Don't get hung out to dry

body.en-US: If your company stops trading, your customers can still have your work covered by our solution guaranteed.
We make all things for all roofs. And courses for all roofers

content.value: BMI Group RoofPro Portal ("Portal")  Privacy Notice
Last updated: 3rd May 2019
Purpose of this Privacy Notice

BMI Malaysia (together, BMI Group or the Company) operate in countries around the world, including in the European Union (EU). On 25 May 2018, the EU General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) became effective. One goal of GDPR is to create greater transparency for individuals about what happens with their personal data.

This Privacy Notice describes how BMI Group (we or us) collects uses, shares and retains the personal data you provide during and after your use of the Portal. We are committed to ensuring that any personal data we receive is protected and handled in accordance with applicable data protection laws.

This Privacy Notice applies to all external parties who share personal data with BMI Group through the Portal, including installers, contractors and company owners ("Portal Users") or individuals whose personal data is uploaded to the Portal by a Portal User, such as building owners (collectively, you).
If you have any questions or concerns about our use of your personal data, then please contact us using the contact details provided at the bottom of this Privacy Notice.
Information we hold and process about you
Personal data means any information about an individual from which that person can be identified. It does not include data where the identity has been removed (that is, anonymous data).

We will collect, store, and use certain categories of personal data about you which is in the context of our engagement or relationship with you through the Portal or where your information is provided to us by a Portal User.

Portal Users: This may include your name, email address, location (town/city and country), work phone number, work postal address, company that you work for, whether you are the owner of the company, your involvement in projects (where details are uploaded to the Portal), any communications with us through the Portal, relevant BMI training that you have undertaken, testimonials and other feedback about you (that we have collected through market research or surveys, such as through a Building Owner Evaluation).

Building Owners: This may include your name, postal address, email address, details of your building project and guarantee. For information on the types of information that we may collect outside of the Portal, such as information you provide as part of a Building Owner Evaluation, please see our
Third Party Privacy Notice

We will collect this information either directly from you, your employer, a work colleague, or from a Portal User (where you are a building owner). From time to time, we may receive personal data about you from other third party sources (such as regulators, third party reference agencies etc.), but only where we have checked that these third parties either have your consent or are otherwise legally permitted or required to disclose your personal data to us.

Note that there may be free text boxes within the Portal, but we expect you to provide the information being requested as part of that free text box. We do not expect you to submit nor request you to send any other type of information, including sensitive data.
Legal Basis and purpose for processing your Personal Data
In most cases, our use of your personal data is necessary in order:
for us to carry out a contract with you or your company/employer (such as a Participation Agreement);
so that we can comply with our legal obligations and/or cooperate with regulators and other authorities; or

for a legitimate interest, such as to fulfil our duties and exercise our specific company rights, to provide you with the benefits associated with the Portal, to maintain a BMI guarantee for work carried out by a Portal User, to manage and improve our business and end user engagements and relationships, for business development, marketing and analysis purposes, to monitor and evaluate the use of our services, to enforce, exercise or defend legal claims.

We will process your personal data only for purposes permitted by law. This includes the above purposes and any other legal legitimate purposes. Some of the above grounds for processing will overlap and there may be several grounds which justify our use of your personal data. Where the above grounds for processing do not apply we may ask for your consent to process your personal data.
If you fail to provide certain information when requested, we may not be able to perform the contract we have entered into with you or we may be prevented from complying with our legal obligations.
Retention and transfers of your personal data
How long do we keep your Personal Data

We will retain your personal data for as long as is reasonably necessary to fulfil the relevant purposes set out in this Privacy Notice. The retention period will primarily be determined by relevant legal and regulatory obligation and/or duration of our business relationship with you. We will securely delete or erase your personal data if there is no valid business reason for retaining your data, for example if you are a Portal User and you close your Portal account there may be no valid business reason for retaining your information. In addition, if your BMI guarantee has expired, there may be no valid business reason for retaining your information. In exceptional circumstances, we may retain your personal data for longer periods of time if we reasonably believe there is a prospect of litigation, in the event of any complaints, or if there is another valid business reason the data will be needed in the future.
Where Personal Data is stored

BMI Group uses appropriate technical and organisational measures to protect the personal data that we collect and process about you. We store your personal data in controlled-access, centralised databases, and secure paper and electronic file in the countries in which BMI Group is located and countries where our service providers are located. The access is limited to authorised users subject to a confidentiality duty, such as the accounting department, the human resources department, or the service providers personnel, on a need to know basis.
Data Sharing
Transfers to third parties

We will share your personal data with third parties where required by law, where it is necessary to administer our relationship with you or complete our obligations under a contract with you, or where we have another legitimate interest in doing so, for example, to provide you with a benefit you have expressed interest in.

Where you are a Portal User, we will share your personal data with your Portal "team members", i.e. other individuals employed by the same company as you. Information that may be shared includes your email address, certifications and projects you have worked on.

All our third-party providers are required to take appropriate security measures to protect your personal data. We only permit third-party service providers to process your personal data for specified purposes and in accordance with our instructions. To the extent reasonably possible, we will ensure all third-party providers that have access to your personal data, will act in accordance with relevant data privacy laws, including the General Data Protection Regulation 2016.

We may also share your personal data with other third parties, for example in the context of the possible sale or restructuring of the business. In this situation we will, so far as possible, share anonymised data with the other parties before the transaction completes. Once the transaction is completed, we will share your personal data with the other parties if and to the extent required under the terms of the transaction.
We may need to share your personal data with a regulator, bureau, agency, broker or third party reference services, or to otherwise comply with the law.
Where permitted by law, we may post testimonials or feedback you have provided to us through the Portal on our website for our legitimate business interests.
Transfers to other BMI Group entities

We may also share your personal data with other entities in the BMI Group, as and where required, as part of our reporting activities, in the context of a business reorganisation or group restructuring exercise, for system maintenance support, and for data hosting purposes.
Transferring information outside the EU

We may transfer the personal data we collect about you to third parties and other BMI Group entities who are outside the EU. To ensure that your personal data receives an adequate level of protection we seek to ensure that your personal data is treated by those third parties and entities outside the EU in a way that is consistent with and which respects the EU laws on data protection, for example, by entering into contractual agreements based on the EU Commissions standard contractual clauses.
Your rights
You have specific legal rights related to BMI Groups processing of your personal data. The following list contains information on your rights arising from applicable data protection laws:
If you wish to
access, correct, update or request deletion
of your personal data, you can do so at any time by contacting us using the contact details provided below.
In addition, you can
object to processing
of your personal data, ask us to
restrict processing
of your personal data or
request portability
of your personal data. Again, you can exercise these rights by contacting us using the contact details provided below.

You have the right to make a complaint at any time to the relevant supervisory Data Protection Authority operating in the jurisdiction you are accessing our services from. For more information please contact your local Data Protection Authority. BMI Group, however, appreciates the chance to deal with your concerns in the first instance, if you would like to contact us on the details below.
Should you wish to invoke these rights, please contact us at privacy@bmigroup.com.
Website information and cookies
Cookies
Please refer to BMI Group's BMI RoofPro Portal Cookie Policy for information about how we use any personal data provided via cookies on the Portal. This policy can be found within the Portal and at
Cookie Policy
BMI Group Websites
Please refer to BMI Group's Third Party Privacy Policy for information about how we use any personal data through our websites. This policy can be found at
Third Party Privacy Notice
Data Protection Officer
Please contact
compliance@bmigroup.com
to contact our data protection officer.
Changes to this Privacy Notice

This Privacy Notice does not form part of any contract with you and we reserve the right to update this Privacy Notice at any time. We will provide you with a new Privacy Notice when we make any substantial updates. We may also notify you in other ways from time to time about the processing of your personal data.
Contact
If you have any questions regarding this Privacy Notice or the way we handle or process your personal data, you can contact us at privacy@bmigroup.com
The data controller of your personal data is BMI Group Management UK Limited.
PLEASE READ THESE TERMS AND CONDITIONS CAREFULLY BEFORE REGISTERING FOR THE PORTAL
What's in these terms?
These terms tell you the rules for using the BMI RoofPro Portal ("the Portal").
Who we are and how to contact us
InTouch

is a site operated by BMI Group Management UK Limited ("We"). We are registered in England and Wales under company number 09987127 and have our registered office at 20 Air Street, 5th Floor, London, England, W1B 5AN.
To contact us, please email
intouch.my@bmigroup.com
or telephone our customer service line on 1800-88-0865.
Licence to use the Portal

Subject to these terms, we hereby grant to you a revocable, non-exclusive, non-transferable right, without the right to grant sub-licences, to use the Portal for the purpose of promoting, managing, organising, facilitating or reviewing services related to the installation of our products.
By registering for the Portal you accept these terms
By registering as a user on the Portal, you accept these terms and you agree to comply with them.
If you do not agree to these terms, you must not use the Portal.
We recommend that you print or download a copy of these terms for future reference.
There are other terms that may apply to you
These terms of use refer to the following additional terms, which also apply to your use of the Portal:
our privacy policy
our our cookie notice
which sets out information about the cookies on the Portal.
If you are accessing the Portal as a 'Company', your use of the Portal is also governed by any Participation Agreement you have entered into with us
We will enter into a separate agreement with you if you:
purchase goods or services from us;
complete any training or certification facilitated by us; or
apply for a guarantee in relation to our products.
These terms do not apply to any of the above transactions.
We may make changes to these terms
We amend these terms from time to time. Every time you wish to use the Portal, please check these terms to ensure you understand the terms that apply at that time.
We may make changes to the Portal
We may update and change the Portal from time to time. We will try to give you reasonable notice of any major changes.
We may suspend or withdraw the Portal

We do not guarantee that the Portal, or any content on it, will always be available or be uninterrupted. We may suspend or withdraw or restrict the availability of all or any part of the Portal for business and operational reasons. We will try to give you reasonable notice of any suspension or withdrawal.

You are also responsible for ensuring that all persons who access the Portal through your internet connection are aware of these terms of use and other applicable terms and conditions, and that they comply with them.
Location restrictions

The Portal is directed to people residing in Denmark, Poland, Finland, Spain, the Netherlands, Belgium, Czech Republic, Italy, France, Sweden, Norway, Portugal, Austria, United Kingdom, Ireland, Hungry, Malaysia, Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania, Germany, South Africa, Turkey and India. We do not represent that content available on or through the Portal is appropriate for use or available in other locations.
You must keep your account details safe
You must treat your email address and password combination as confidential. You must not disclose it to any third party.

We have the right to disable any account or password, whether chosen by you or allocated by us, at any time, if in our reasonable opinion you have failed to comply with any of the provisions of these terms.
If you know or suspect that anyone other than you knows your email and password combination, you must promptly notify us at intouch.my@bmigroup.com
How you may use material on the Portal

We are the owner or the licensee of all intellectual property rights in the Portal, and in the material published on it. Those works are protected by copyright laws and treaties around the world. All such rights are reserved.

You may print off copies, and may download extracts, of any pages from the Portal for your personal or internal business use and you may draw the attention of others within your organisation to content posted on the Portal.

You must not modify the paper or digital copies of any materials you have printed off or downloaded in any way, and you must not use any illustrations, photographs, video or audio sequences or any graphics separately from any accompanying text.
Our status (and that of any identified contributors) as the authors of content on the Portal must always be acknowledged.

You must not use any part of the content on the Portal for commercial purposes without obtaining a licence to do so from us or our licensors and complying with any brand guidelines notified to you by us.

If you print off, copy or download any part of the Portal in breach of these terms of use, your right to use the Portal will cease immediately and you must, at our option, return or destroy any copies of the materials you have made.
Uploading content to the Portal

Whenever you make use of a feature that allows you to upload content to the Portal (for example, when you add photos to the 'Projects' tab), or to make contact with other users of the Portal, you must comply with the content standards set out in part 18.

You warrant that any such contribution does comply with those standards, and you will be liable to us and indemnify us for any breach of that warranty. This means you will be responsible for any loss or damage we suffer as a result of your breach of warranty.
Any content you upload to the Portal will be considered non-confidential and non-proprietary.

You retain all of your ownership rights in your content, but you are required to grant us, and other users of the Portal, a limited licence to use, store and copy that content and to distribute and make it available to third parties. The rights you license to us are described in part 13.

We also have the right to disclose your identity to any third party who is claiming that any content posted or uploaded by you to the Portal constitutes a violation of their intellectual property rights, or of their right to privacy.

We have the right to remove any posting you make on the Portal if, in our opinion, your post does not comply with the content standards set out in part 18, or for any other reason at our sole discretion.
You are solely responsible for securing and backing up your content.
Rights you are giving us to use material you upload
When you upload or post content to the Portal, you grant us a perpetual, worldwide, non-exclusive, royalty-free, transferable licence to:
use, reproduce, distribute and prepare derivative works of your content:
in connection with the Portal and across different media;
to promote the Portal; and
for any of our other business purposes, and
grant a sublicence to third parties to use your content in accordance with the functionality of the Portal.
Do not spam other users of the Portal

You must only use the communication and message functionality of the Portal to communicate with other users about our products, or installation services related to our products. All communications you make over the Portal must comply with part 22.

You must not use the Portal to advertise any third party products or services. You must not use the Portal to deliver any spam to other users, engage in unlawful multi-level marketing, or engage in any form of unsolicited or unlawful direct marketing. All communications and messages you send or instigate over the Portal must comply with the Privacy and Electronic Communications Regulations 2003, the General Data Protection Regulation 2016 and any other applicable local laws.

You warrant that any communications you send over the Portal comply with this part 14, and you will be liable to us and indemnify us for any breach of that warranty. This means you will be responsible for any loss or damage we suffer as a result of your breach of warranty.
Do not spam third parties with invitations to use the Portal

You must only send invitations to use the Portal to third parties that have consented to receive invitations or marketing material from us. You must comply with the Privacy and Electronic Communications Regulations 2003, the General Data Protection Regulation 2016 and any other applicable local laws when you send invitations over the Portal.

You warrant that any invitations you send over the Portal comply with this part 15, and you will be liable to us and indemnify us for any breach of that warranty. This means you will be responsible for any loss or damage we suffer as a result of your breach of warranty.
Do not rely on information on the Portal

The content on the Portal is provided for general information only. It is not intended to amount to advice on which you should rely. You must obtain professional or specialist advice before taking, or refraining from, any action on the basis of the content on the Portal.

Although we make reasonable efforts to update the information on the Portal, we make no representations, warranties or guarantees, whether express or implied, that the content on the Portal is accurate, complete or up to date.
We are not responsible for websites we link to

Where the Portal contains links to other sites and resources provided by third parties, these links are provided for your information only. Such links should not be interpreted as approval by us of those linked websites or information you may obtain from them.
We have no control over the contents of those sites or resources.
User-generated content is not approved by us
The Portal includes information and materials uploaded by other users of the Portal. This information and these materials have not been verified or approved by us.
If you wish to complain about information and materials uploaded by other users please contact us on intouch.my@bmigroup.com
Our responsibility for loss or damage suffered by you
The Portal is provided on an "as is" and an "as available" basis.

All warranties, representations, conditions and all other terms of any kind whatsoever implied by statute or common law that apply to the Portal or any content on it, are, to the fullest extent permitted by applicable law, excluded from these terms. We do not exclude or limit in any way our liability to you where it would be unlawful to do so. This includes liability for death or personal injury caused by our negligence or the negligence of our employees, agents or subcontractors and for fraud or fraudulent misrepresentation.

We will not be liable to you for any loss or damage, whether in contract, tort (including negligence), breach of statutory duty, or otherwise, even if foreseeable, arising under or in connection with:
use of, or inability to use, the Portal; or
use of or reliance on any content displayed on the Portal.
In particular, we will not be liable for:
loss of data;
loss of profits, sales, business, or revenue;
business interruption;
loss of anticipated savings;
loss of business opportunity, goodwill or reputation; or
any indirect or consequential loss or damage.
Exclusion of liability for digital content

If defective digital content that we have supplied, damages a device or digital content belonging to you and this is caused by our failure to use reasonable care and skill, we will either repair the damage or pay you compensation. However, we will not be liable for damage that you could have avoided by following our advice to apply an update offered to you free of charge or for damage that was caused by you failing to have in place any minimum system requirements advised by us.
How we may use your personal information
We will only use your personal information as set out in ourPrivacy Policy
Acceptable use of the Portal
You must not access, store, distribute or transmit any material during the course of your use of the Portal that:
is unlawful, harmful, threatening, defamatory, obscene, infringing, harassing or racially or ethnically offensive;
facilitates illegal activity;
depicts sexually explicit images;
promotes unlawful violence;
is discriminatory based on race, gender, colour, religious belief, sexual orientation, disability; or
in a manner that is otherwise illegal or causes damage or injury to any person or property.
We are not responsible for viruses and you must not introduce them
We do not guarantee that the Portal will be secure or free from bugs or viruses.
You are responsible for configuring your information technology, computer programmes and platform to access the Portal. You should use your own virus protection software.

You must not misuse the Portal by knowingly introducing viruses, trojans, worms, logic bombs or other material that is malicious or technologically harmful. You must not attempt to gain unauthorised access to the Portal, any server on which the Portal is stored or any server, computer or database connected to the Portal. You must not attack the Portal via a denial-of-service attack or a distributed denial-of service attack. By breaching this provision, you would commit a criminal offence under the Computer Misuse Act 1990. We will report any such breach to the relevant law enforcement authorities and we will co-operate with those authorities by disclosing your identity to them. In the event of such a breach, your right to use the Portal will cease immediately.
Rules about linking to the Portal
You may link to the home page of the Portal, provided you do so in a way that is fair and legal and does not damage our reputation or take advantage of it.
You must not establish a link in such a way as to suggest any form of association, approval or endorsement on our part where none exists.
You must not establish a link to the Portal in any website that is not owned by you.
The Portal must not be framed on any other site, nor may you create a link to any part of the Portal other than the home page.
We reserve the right to withdraw linking permission without notice.
The website in which you are linking must comply in all respects with the content standards set out in part 22.
If you wish to link to or make any use of content on the Portal other than that set out above, please contact intouch.my@bmigroup.com.
Which country's laws apply to any disputes?

If you are a consumer, please note these terms of use, their subject matter and their formation, are governed by English law. You and we both agree that the courts of England and Wales will have exclusive jurisdiction except that if you are a resident of Northern Ireland you may also bring proceedings in Northern Ireland, and if you are resident of Scotland, you may also bring proceedings in Scotland.

If you are a business, these terms of use, their subject matter and their formation (and any non-contractual disputes or claims) are governed by English law. We both agree to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of England and Wales.
No partnership or agency

Nothing in these terms is intended to, or shall operate to, create a partnership between you and us. Nothing in these terms authorises you to act as agent for us. Nothing in these terms gives you the authority to act in our name or on behalf of us, or otherwise to bind us in any way (including the making of any representation or warranty, the assumption of any obligation or liability and the exercise of any right or power).
BMI Group InTouch Portal  Cookie Policy
Last updated: 8th October2019

This Cookie Policy explains how BMI Group Management UK Limited and its affiliated legal entities (together, BMI Group or the Company) uses cookies and similar technologies to recognise you when you visit our BMI Group InTouch Portal ("Portal") at my.intouch.bmigroup.com.It explains what these technologies are and why we use them, as well as your rights to control our use of them.
What are cookies?
Cookies are small text files which are placed on your computer or mobile device when you first visit a website. Cookies are used to make the Portal work well or simply work more efficiently.

Cookies set by the Portal owner (in this case, BMI Group) are called "first party cookies". Cookies set by parties other than the Portal owner are called "third party cookies". Third party cookies enable third party features or functionality to be provided on or through the Portal.
What are cookies used for?
We use cookies for technical reasons in order for our Portal to operate, and we refer to these as "essential" or "strictly necessary" cookies.

The cookies we use are strictly necessary to provide you with services available through our Portal and to use some of its features, such as access to secure areas. Because these cookies are strictly necessary to deliver the Portal to you, you cannot refuse them. You can block or delete them by changing your browser settings however, as described below under the heading "How to manage and disable cookies".
We also use third party cookies to improve our site experience and to access content usage. Details of third party cookies are set out below.
The BMI Group uses the following cookies:
x.xCookie Name:
BMICookie
Provider:
BMI Group
Description:
TBC
Purpose:
tbc
How to manage and disable cookies

In the settings of your internet browser you can choose whether or not to accept cookies. However, you must be aware of the fact that if you use your browser settings to block all cookies you may lose some features and functionality on our Portal or you may not be able to access some or all parts of the Portal.
The following websites provide information on how to manage and adjust the cookies settings on some popular browsers:
Google Chrome
https://support.google.com/chrome/answer/95647?hl=en&p=cpn_cookies
Microsoft Internet Explorer
https://support.microsoft.com/en-gb/help/260971/description-of-cookies
Mozilla Firefox
http://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/cookies-information-websites-store-on-your-computer?redirectlocale=en-GB&redirectslug=Cookies
If you use other browsers you can check the support section of their websites to find out how to manage and disable cookies.
To find out more about cookies in general, including how to see what cookies have been set and how to manage and disable them, visit
www.allaboutcookies.org
If you have any questions regarding this Cookie Policy, you can contact us at privacy@bmigroup.com
Provide a photo evidencing that the membranes are sealed and intact to prevent water getting in.
Provide a photo of the team working on the roof in situ.  Demonstrate that they are working safely, with adequate tools and facilities for a project of this size.
Provide at least 2 photos of the drainage demonstrating that rain water will run off in an orderly way under normal conditions.

description.en-US:
The BMI Academy provides you with the skills you need to fit BMI products.  The Academy is an online offering with access to e-learning modules, webinars and the ability to book on site workshops at our many training centres.

Get the edge over your competitors with BMI Academy by upgrading and maintaining your skills, and getting certified in the technologies you need to be at the cutting edge of modern roofing.

step1Description.en-US: Browse our extensive list of online and on-site training options from the BMI Academy training catalogue to find out which course will take your skills to the next step.

step2Description.en-US: Continuous personal development will keep your skills sharp and make you a valuable asset to the projects you work on.

step3Description.en-US: Taking courses that carry certifications will let others know that you have the skills needed to carry out certain work.  Certfications will be viewable on your profile page.

content.value: Extended guarantees
Enhanced roofer locator and marketing support package.
Visibility tools
Your company appears in 'Find a Roofer'
Exclusive BMI events
Access to exclusive events in your region

shortDescription.en-US: The Partner Tier gives an exclusive BMI paper weight plus 3% off when if buy a new 40 tonnes of bitumen from one of our partners.

content.value: Extended guarantees
Extended validation periods for System Guarantees
Visibility tools
Your company appears in 'Find a Roofer'.
Exclusive BMI events
Access to all BMI events and free access to 3 events per year in your region.

shortDescription.en-US: The Expert tier gives you free advice over the phone and VIP invitations to our annual party.

content.value: Extended guarantees
Extended validation periods on solution guarantees.
Visibility tools
Your company appears in 'Find a Roofer' with high visibility
Free BMI events
Access to all BMI events and free entry to events in your region

shortDescription.en-US: The Elite tier gives you extended guarantees, high visibility to new customers and free entry to events in your region.
